column1: IAU_CHROM v5.15+ database reference table (171124)
explanations, general:
> do not use semicolon anywhere in the text exept as separator!
> col 1, row 1 denotes number of header lines (including column header).
> also fixed: last processed timestamp goes into the third-to-last row, first column (column header = last row).
> every row configures a specific experiment.
> upon call, iau_chrom will auto-integrate all experiments set "active" in the table.
> after proccessing, iau_chrom will modify this database table and save a new copy (modified filename) with updated values.
> database reference table is "backwards linking", i.e. only lower levels are linked: iau_chrom.db does not link to iau_dataproc files but an iau_dataproc.db file can link to a iau_chrom.db file.
explanations, column-specific:
active - (0, 1) enter a 1 to process this experiment, set to 0 to skip. Will be set to 0 after the experiment has been processed.
exp_id - name of experiment, must be unique.
exp_descr - experiment description, optional.
exp_data_dir - directory or folder where data is located (i.e. .cdf, .h5 etc. files). If data of one experiment is found in multiple folders in different directories, separate paths by ",".
exp_data_tag - part of filename that specifies files that belong to the experiment. Leave blank to use all files from the specified folder.
exp_msinfo_path - file path to ms.info to use for this experiment.
data_import_fct - string that defines the data import function of iau_chrom: 'aes_cdf', 'agilent_cdf', 'almsco_cdf', 'agilent_cdf', 'ecd_fid_cdf', 'ecd_txt', 'tofwerk_h5'.

savefile_path - where the chrom.sav will be saved. Leave blank to save *chrom.dat file in a subfolder where data is located. The filename will be generated automatically unless specified (must end with *chrom.dat). Warning: a specified filename might cause overwrite.
save_txtreport - (0, 1) save the good old .txt report files with results for each substance in a sub-folder 'txt_report' in savefile_path.
save_quicklook - (0, 1) generate a results quicklook document (postscript).
autoint_timestamp - timestamp when this experiment was processed by IAU_Chrom "dd.mm.yyyy hh:mn:ss".
hit_index (0.0-1.0) - n_peaks_found / def_substances*n_chromatograms.
last processed ("dd.mm.yyyy hh:mn:ss"):
# end of header #
active (boolean)
